alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 1:49PM CDT until June 11 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sweetwater Creek at Kelton 5N affecting Wheeler County. For the Sweetwater Creek...including Kelton 5N...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Sweetwater Creek at Kelton 5N. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water overflows both banks. Cattle in flood plain are threatened and should have easy access to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet early this evening, then fall to 9.9 feet late tonight. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
